intro: Ardisia stevensii, commonly known as the Florida beautyberry, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the southeastern United States, particularly Florida and Georgia. The plant is characterized by its clusters of small, bright red berries that appear in the fall. These berries are a key feature in its ornamental value and attract various birds and insects. Ardisia stevensii typically grows in moist, acidic soils and thrives in partial to full shade.
